qas.question: Changes keep happening because new cultural stuff meets these type of innovations.
What have researchers in science labs been making?
What elementary force can some specialized fabrics generate?
What can garments made with kevlar resist?
Stain-resistant fabrics are coated with chemicals to reduce what?

plausible_answers.text: new cultural influences meet technological innovations.

qas.question: Why is clothing slow to change?
Scientists are developing what they can serve either a functional purpose for a traditional

plausible_answers.text: bullet-resistant garments made with kevlar and stain-resistant fabrics

context: The world of clothing is always changing, as <b5_0>new cultural influences meet <a0_0>technological<a0_0/> innovations.<b5_0/> Researchers in scientific labs have been developing <a1_0><b6_0>prototypes<a1_0/> for fabrics<b6_0/> that can serve functional purposes well beyond their traditional roles, for example, clothes that can automatically adjust their temperature, repel <a3_0>bullets<a3_0/>, project images, and generate <a2_0>electricity<a2_0/>. Some practical advances already available to consumers are <b7_0>bullet-resistant garments made with kevlar and stain-resistant fabrics<b7_0/> that are coated with chemical mixtures that reduce the <a4_0>absorption of <b8_0>liquids<a4_0/>.
